analysis:
Entries in art and design subjects have increased a little across the UK over the last six years. The +3.2% change compared to a change of +10.7% in all A-Level entries over the last six years. Over the same period, the 18-year-old population has changed by approximately 6.1%.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved the top grades in art and design subjects in 2024 compared to all A-Level subjects. A total of 31.9% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in art and design subjects compared to 27.8% for all subjects.

Entries in biology have increased across the UK over the last six years. The +7.5% change compared to a change of +10.7% in all A-Level entries over the last six years. Over the same period, the 18-year-old population has changed by approximately 6.1%.

Across the UK, a broadly similar proportion of students achieved the top grades in biology in 2024 as did so across all A-Level subjects. A total of 27.7% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in biology compared to 27.8% for all subjects.

Across the UK, a smaller proportion of students achieved the top grades in business studies in 2024 compared to all A-Level subjects. A total of 16.2% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in business studies compared to 27.8% for all subjects.
